meanings.definition: A short piece remaining on a trunk or stem where a branch is lost.
meanings.sent1: The tree had many stubs where branches had fallen off.
meanings.sent2: She picked up the stubs of branches that littered the ground.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used the tree stubs as tiny seats for its acorn feast.
meanings.sent4: The garden looked like a forest of stubs after the storm passed.
meanings.sent5: The stubs on the tree looked like little arms reaching out for help.

meanings.definition: A small piece of paper, metal, or other material that is attached to something larger and is meant to be torn off or removed.
meanings.sent1: He tore off the ticket stub and handed it to the attendant.
meanings.sent2: The stub of the receipt was all that remained in the book.
meanings.sent3: She collected the movie ticket stubs to remember the fun nights out.
meanings.sent4: The metal stub on the coupon made it easy to tear off.
meanings.sent5: The stub of the label was stuck to the bottom of the jar.
